message.content:
<<<api>>>: RelativeLayout.LayoutParams and RelativeLayout.addView
<<<code>>>: 
public void showkeyword(){
    LayoutInflater inflater = (LayoutInflater) getSystemService(Context.LAYOUT_INFLATER_SERVICE);
    RelativeLayout fl =  (RelativeLayout)findViewById(R.id.key_layout);
    fl.removeAllViews();
    RelativeLayout.LayoutParams params ;
    int prevTextViewId = 0;
    int i = 0;
    for(String s : alist){
        TextView textView = new TextView(this);
        textView.setText(s);
        textView.setId(i + 1);
        params = new RelativeLayout.LayoutParams(RelativeLayout.LayoutParams.WRAP_CONTENT, RelativeLayout.LayoutParams.WRAP_CONTENT);
        params.addRule(RelativeLayout.ALIGN_PARENT_TOP);
        params.addRule(RelativeLayout.RIGHT_OF, prevTextViewId);
        textView.setLayoutParams(params);
        prevTextViewId = textView.getId();
        fl.addView(textView, params);
        i++;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are trying to add TextViews to the RelativeLayout dynamically. The problem is that you are not correctly setting the rule for the TextView to be to the right of the previous one. In the corrected code, we create a new TextView for each string in the list, set its text, and give it an ID. We then create new LayoutParams for each TextView, and add the rule that it should be to the right of the previous TextView. We then set these LayoutParams to the TextView, and add it to the RelativeLayout. The ID of the current TextView is then stored in prevTextViewId for use in the next iteration.
